text: R5.9. Page table bits and levels A CPU uses virtual addresses that are 48 bits long, and has 4096 byte pages. Page table entries are 16 bytes long, and the higher-order 12 bits of the virtual address are unused. Assume no space in the page tables is wasted. How many PTEs does each page table contain? intege How many levels of page tables does this CPU have? intege Save & Grade Single attempt Additional attempts available with new variants @
